explicit.graphviz

Class Decoration

  • java.lang.Object
    • explicit.graphviz.Decoration

  • public class Decoration
extends java.lang.Object
    A Decoration stores the attributes (label and style information) that can be attached to a GraphViz node or edge.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Decoration.LabelType
      An indication of how the node or edge's label should be rendered by Graphviz

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> attributes
      Map from attribute keys to values (apart from the label attribute)
      private Decoration defaults
      A Decoration that provides default attributes, e.g., node shape
      private java.lang.String label
      The label
      private Decoration.LabelType labelType
      How the label should be rendered by Graphviz (by plain text, as default)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Decoration()
      Constructor, no defaults
      Decoration(Decoration defaults)
      Constructor, with defaults decoration

    • Method Detail

      • attributes

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> attributes()
        Returns a map for accessing attributes (apart from the label attribute)

      • attributesRO

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> attributesRO()
        Returns a read-only map for accessing attributes (apart from the label attribute).
        Note: If you only need read access, it might be more efficient to use this method instead of attributes().

      • getEffectiveValue

        public java.lang.String getEffectiveValue(java.lang.String key)
        Get the effective value for the given key.
        If the key equals "label", returns the label. Otherwise, if there is an attribute with the given key, return its value. If there is none, try the defaults decoration.
        Parameters:
        key - the attribute key
        Returns:
        the value, if there is one (null otherwise)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getLabel

        public java.lang.String getLabel()
        Get the label text

      • setLabel

        public void setLabel(java.lang.String label)
        Set the label text. Note: Ensure that the label text is properly quoted for the used label type.

      • getLabelType

        public Decoration.LabelType getLabelType()
        Get the label type

      • setLabelType

        public void setLabelType(Decoration.LabelType labelType)
        Set the label type (this should be done before calling the labelAddBelow or labelAddAbove methods, to ensure that the correct line delimiter is inserted)

      • labelAddBelow

        public void labelAddBelow(java.lang.String additional)
        Add some additional information below the currently existing label. Note: Ensure that the label text is properly quoted for the used label type.

      • labelAddAbove

        public void labelAddAbove(java.lang.String additional)
        Add some additional information above the currently existing label. Note: Ensure that the label text is properly quoted for the used label type.
        Parameters:
        additional - the additional text

      • labelAddRight

        public void labelAddRight(java.lang.String additional,
                          java.lang.String separator)
        Add some additional information to the right of the currently existing label. Note: Ensure that the label text is properly quoted for the used label type.
        Parameters:
        additional - the additional text
        separator - the separator between the old label and the additional text (may be null)

      • labelAddLeft

        public void labelAddLeft(java.lang.String additional,
                         java.lang.String separator)
        Add some additional information to the left of the currently existing label. Note: Ensure that the label text is properly quoted for the used label type.
        Parameters:
        additional - the additional text
        separator - the separator between the old label and the additional text (may be null)
